page.title: 14TOWN CENTRE, RUGELEY
page.content: The redevelopment of Rugeley has preserved the pattern of streets and squares in the town centre. Shops have been refurbished to give larger shop front displays; the few new buildings have been confined to 2 storeys. In 1980 the town centre was closed to traffic and in 1984/85 the streets were repaved in brick. New street furniture of benches, cast-iron lamp standards and raised flower beds in the narrow streets suggest a period charm. Most of the small, old town houses have been demolished and replaced by car parks and service areas behind the shops. The old covered market has been demolished except for the clock tower. The new covered market has 43 permanent stalls and a roof-top car park. Three new supermarkets have been built on the edge of the town centre.
